title: Source build assumes "bash" shell
body:
by **achowe**: 
Downloaded the source build to OpenBSD 4.3 system. Proceeded to unpack and build. Build
fails because scripts assume "bash" shell, which is NOT a portable assumption. 

For portability across platforms, shell scripts should assume a Bourne shell (sh) or
POSIX / SUS Korn shell (ksh). OpenBSD and NetBSD provide these as standard. Bash is a
Linux version of the Korn shell and should not be assumed to present or exist by that
name on all systems.

For portability across multiple platforms use /bin/sh (or /bin/ksh).
